alert.note: Alert for Adams; Brown; Pike; Ross; Scioto (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 10:42PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF MASON, ROBERTSON, LEWIS, SOUTHEASTERN BROWN, CENTRAL ADAMS, PIKE, SCIOTO AND SOUTHEASTERN ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 1130 PM EDT... At 1042 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 10 miles southeast of Kincaid Springs, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Chillicothe, Portsmouth, Maysville, Wheelersburg, Waverly, Washington, West Union, New Boston, Piketon, Manchester, Aberdeen, Vanceburg, South Webster, Lewisburg, Camp Dix, Lucasville, Sciotodale, Rosemount, Clarktown and Rome. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for northern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 200 AM EDT for northeastern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
